page.title: 12CHANGING TIMES IN BARSBY
page.content: Many of the old residents in Barsby have lived there most of thier lives. they have witnessed many changes in Barsby of which some they much regret. Mrs King allowed us to interview her about life in Barsby. Mrs King has lived in Barsby for 43 years and at 71 she is one of the residents. Mrs King remembers the time before electricity and water were in Barsby , when people had oil lamps and fetched water from a pump. Even today there is no gas in Barsby. Many of the houses were built small and as large famillies were common when Mrs King first moved to Barsby, famillies had to live a cramped lifestyle. There used to be a bakers and a butcher, and a public house. now only the public house remains. Most people worked on the farms, while at the same time kept pigs and hens at home.
